posts.post_content:
Turn 1: Bazaar, use and pitch a good target.  
Turn 2: Swamp. From here, unless you're absolutely satisfied with your hand and your graveyard, you'll want to use the Bazaar's ability again and try to draw something better/pitch something better. From there, you should be able to [Reanimate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reanimate) a nice target from your graveyard or use [Entomb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Entomb) to search for one. If you   
  
The reason why Bazaar is so awesome is because it helps your reanimator deck gain a lot of consistency. Not only does it give you a way of pitch your reanimation targets if you happen to draw them - it also helps you find your reanimation spells. After a mere two uses, you'll have drawn 4 extra cards and discarded 6, among which ought to be at least one of your reanimation targets. And if you didn't pitch a target, you ought to at least have drawn either [Entomb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Entomb) or [Buried Alive](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Buried Alive), and possibly a reanimation spell if you didn't have any of them to b... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: Radagast (11/3/2011 6:46:04 PM)

posts.post_content:
"Wow, this land is horrible. -1 Card advantage every time you tap it? You might as well just play One With Nothing."  
  
When the point of a deck is to play from the graveyard, this land accelerates things greatly. You can net a turn 2 win easily with a good Dredge deck and a little luck on the draw.  
  
In the right deck, this card is game breaking.
posts.html:

posts.post_content: This card is amazing and awesome. This is no suicide bomb, this card is great for ichorid/dredge in type 1. In casual play, this card works wonders as well, with madness, reanimator, ichorid, and dredge. How can you forgot Squee also? He breaks this card in half.
